job_description:
The Team:
ING is Thinking Forward and is all about empowering people to stay a step ahead in life and business. And it’s important that our Global Procurement team can help ING to deliver the strategy.
In essence, the Global Procurement team is responsible for purchasing and entering into contracts with suppliers of ING and is the owner of the procurement policies, controls and system platforms to be used by the local procurement and business functions.
Global Procurement ensures the acquisition of the ‘right goods and services’ at the right time, place, and best conditions’ in a sustainable manner. To be able to deliver this promise in the best way possible, the Global Procurement team has recently been re-designed.
Job Overview:
You will be the global data officer for the Procurement domain. You will build a data management strategy and vision of data management in ING Procurement.
This role ensures that within Procurement and in all systems and platforms used by Procurement, data management is implemented which is compliant with laws, regulations and internal ING policies and governance. You will develop best practices so to make it a competitive advantage.
Key Responsibilities:
You will be responsible for activities related to data management for the global procurement function:
Develops a procurement data management vision and strategy , promote and gathers support for this vision. Reaches agreements on this with management and partners outside his or her own domain.
Implement and maintain a consistent taxonomy on procurement data.
Assure the procurement data vision is consistently implemented throughout all procurement platforms and solutions.
Streamline data collection, analysis and consolidation to ensure robust data and overall consistency.
Maintain procurement databases and conduct routine checks to assess data integrity and takes steps to assure data quality.
Liaise with the Global Data Office to assure alignment with ING Policies and practices in this field.
Requirements:
You ‘build bridges’ between the business users on the one hand and IT departments (suppliers) on the other, and you support the business unit in designing and implementing information management. You will, as and when needed, select parties for the realisation of the design and build and will take on the role of project manager, if required. You take a helicopter view in assessing the coherence, overlap and dependencies in information management. You converts business' information needs into a design. You will produce complex reports and analyses. You are a sparring partner to Senior Management. You focus on strategic information management issues. You manage projects, possibly several projects a time when the occasion arises. You coach and support colleagues on content. You are proficient in Microsoft (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). You are a star communicator at all levels of the organization.
Specific Requirements:
Master level in computer science, engineering or equivalent fields.
Ideally, 10 years of experience in data management in complex and international organisation.
Ability to master large data sets and complex data structures, to extract conclusions on data consistency and quality and detect anomalies.
Understanding the links between data and business/procurement processes.

About Ultimaker

With 251–500 people and HQ in Utrecht, Ultimaker accelerated the world’s transformation to flexible, empowering, and sustainable solutions. In 2022, Ultimaker merged with MakerBot to form a leading organization in desktop 3D printing. Providing easy-to-use and accessible 3D printing hardware, software, and materials for any application, driving the industry to a future state of responsible and sustainable manufacturing resulted in a larger turnover than $150 million.
Since 2011, Ultimaker's focus on innovation and research has led to the development of highly multidisciplinary tech - versatile printers that can print with a wide range of materials, from plastics to metals and composites to accelerate growth. Moving forward, Ultimaker’s ambition is to continue driving new product innovation, expanding the product line and improving the technology to stay ahead of the curve in the evolving world of 3D printing.

Responsibilities

UltiMaker is looking for a talented CTO and Head of Engineering to join our Management Team. You will report to, and work closely with the CEO and act as a technology leader by setting the tech vision and adapt the organization accordingly.

Set the Company’s technological vision, moving from hardware to a software based focus using machine learning and AI
Manage and shape the engineering teams, both for hardware and software products (100+FTE), creating a high degree of ‘togetherness’
Work with the Product team to set a dispersive roadmap
Integrate people, process and technologies into a strong performing organization
Managing our R&D and Engineering budgets
Ensuring that the technological resources are aligned with the company's business needs.
Ensure on-time delivery of budget, roadmap, and timelines, not accepting slacking on deadlines
Education

BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field; MBA or other relevant graduate degree is a plus

Language

Fluent in English
Fluent in Dutch is a plus

Experience

Minimum 5 years experience as a CTO in a scale up
Minimal 7 years of experience managing technology teams of 50+ FTE
Strong track record in commercializing software proposition & business development in an agile way of working
Thorough understanding of connectivity of hardware, firmware and software: embedded software, Python, C++, Google Cloud solutions and Open Source
Strong understanding of budgets and business-planning
Experience with 3D Printing, CNC machining, or other manufacturing processes

Competencies

Strong communication skills: ability to present to all levels of the organization and relay project needs across multiple language barriers
Advanced technological skill set: proficiency to conduct technological analyses, with an ability to build a disruptive strategy
Strategic agility: able to learn fast and come with a different approach for complex challenges
Leadership: able to take assured decisions without a full picture, and motivate teams to move beyond the current product
Influencing skills: able to be respected by the team members using both tech knowledge and people management
Cultural awareness: able to cultural awareness/flexibility. It’s both Dutch and American.

Personality

Entrepreneurial
People connector
Finisher
Intelligent

Functieomschrijving
The LSP specifications are written in Dutch and the client requires that their client´s functional designs are made in Dutch.The client strives for a close cooperation between their architects and product specialists and our client´s software team; frequent collaboration is explicitly asked for. To expand the development team our client is looking for both a junior and medior software developer. Within a project team of approximately 10 people your tasks will be:
Translating the requirements and implementation guides to designs (senior role)
Collaboration with architects on feasibility and practicality of new requirements / AORTA design choices (senior role)
Translating designs to software components
Programming the software components in IRIS
Fixing the bugs found in the system test
Given the complexity of the domain, our client expects candidates to join the team at least a couple of years. The language in the workplace will be Dutch.
Functie-eisen
Bachelors degree in software engineering, computer science or related field
Experience with a modern O-O programming language
Experience with software development methodologies and life cycle management
Good communication skills to communicate with systems- and software architects, peer developers, testers, customer, support personnel and management
Proficiency in the Dutch Language, written and orally (senior)
Experience with Intersystems technology is beneficial
Experience with Healthcare data exchange standards such as HL7v3, FHIR, XDR etc is beneficial
Experience with containers and microservices is beneficial
The senior developer must be willing to work occasionally on the client premises.
Bedrijfsprofiel
In the location Rijswijk, the Netherlands, our client has a team that develops and operates the LSP (Landelijk SchakelPunt) and the Healthcare Provider Directory (Zorg-AB).
The LSP and Zorg-AB form the heart of the basic IT infrastructure for the Dutch healthcare sector (called AORTA). It is the ´´control tower´´ that enables and ensures the secure nationwide electronic exchange of patient information. Healthcare units and practitioners exchange Electronic Health Record data, using the information hub of the LSP with its central index. AORTA is based on the HL7 interoperability standards such as HL7v3, FHIR, XDR, etc. The LSP is built on the IRIS for Health platform of Intersystems.
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
50% of the time you will be working at the office and 50% remotely.
You will receive a one year contract, which will be converted into a fixed-term contract afterwards.
Regio
Zuid-Holland
Publicatiedatum
24.03.2023
Contactpersoon
Gupta

About Majorel

At Majorel we design, deliver and differentiate customer experience on behalf of some of the world’s most respected brands. We create amazing customer experiences that people value and we are proud of. By combining talent, data and technology we deliver real impact for our partners.

We serve customers across the world through our 82,000+ employees based in 44 countries in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, Americas and Asia in 60 languages. We support customers at any time, through every device and in the manner, they expect of their brands. We speak their language wherever they are and whatever their culture.

Majorel employees are differentiated by a particular kind of drive – we are always driven to go further to do the best we can every single day. We are relentless, resourceful, resilient, agile, energetic and focused and if you are too, we’ll provide you with an environment that will let you thrive.

Job summary

Enterprise Architecture coordinator (EA coordinator) is responsible to support the definition, implementation and monitoring the enterprise architecture principles. The EA coordinator is a driving force in the animation of the Enterprise Architecture community. This position also guarantees the communication and application of the enterprise standards.


Main responsibilities

Governance / Library:

Administers the tools necessary for the operation of the Enterprise Architecture community
Ensures the updating of all processes and documents related to EA standards

Support & Coordination:

Animate a community of solution & technical architects
Ensure alignment with all stakeholders by documenting, sharing and communicating
Enterprise Architecture principles
Facilitate business case development and solution selection process
Ensuring that all stakeholders are carrying out their tasks efficiently while upholding the company's standards
Ensure the update and the map of all IT assets

Strategic:

Organize strategic committees such as Enterprise Architecture Board
 Track the adherence on future state roadmap
Produce reports used to drive review meetings

Additional task can be assigned at any time.

Competencies & professional background

Educational Background:

Associates degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field, or relevant experience.
TOGAF and/or other architecture framework knowledge are a plus
Project Management certification is a plus

Technical Skills: (knowledge, experiences, IT tools/software, languages)

A significant experience in Architect, Project Management or PMO roles
English speaker
Advanced MSOffice (MS Teams, Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint) skills.
Experience with architecture software such as LEANIX is a plus
Knowledge of Lean PPM concept is a plus

Soft Skills:

Communication: Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent organizational skills
Experienced meeting facilitator, working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Self-motivated and directed, more doers than thinkers
Open minded

 Does the profile match your CV and are you interested? Please press the apply button below!

 At Majorel, diversity is a part of our DNA. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities and creating an inclusive environment for all candidates and employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability status, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression.

Do you have a positive track record in the broad domain of IT Infrastructure and Operations, and do you like to get your hands dirty every now and then? Then keep on reading!

Functie

Normec is at the brink of modernizing and optimizing it’s IT infrastructure and operations globally. Normec is seeking a leader capable of driving this multi-year strategic program and lead and guide the IT teams involved. Are you a builder who excels at combining a long term technology vision with delivering pragmatic services that add business value today? Then you might be Normecs Director of IT Infrastructure and Operations. In this position you will be a member of the Global IT leadership team of Normec and report directly to the CIO. You will work closely with Group IT teams and the IT teams in the business lines of Normec.
Your responsibilities:
Shape and define the IT Infrastructure and Operations strategy, roadmap and priorities that enable and support strategic business goals. This includes Hosting and Cloud platform services, Network, Connectivity, Workspace, Transition and Transformation (T&T), Support, Vendor management and ITSM/Service Management.
Drive execution of the roadmap together with the IT teams and the business.
Recruit, build and manage teams with the right capabilities, aligned with technology choices, that best support the Normec IT strategy.
Sponsor and drive the Cloud transformation journey, establish the Cloud centre of Excellence.
Own the IT Infrastructure and Operations technology landscape and architecture keeping it stable, secure and scalable to drive best cost for value.
Ensure day-2-day IT Infrastructure and Operations, monitoring and follow up to ensure issues are pro-actively resolved to avoid any business disruption.
Manage vendors/outsourcing partners related to IT infrastructure and operations, negotiate all new major IT contracts.
Engage with senior internal and external stakeholders (e.g. Chief Executive-level executives) as a peer, providing subject matter expertise.
Bedrijf

Normec is a fast growing, international enterprise in the TICC sector. They have offices in The Netherlands, Belgium, Germany and are looking for further expansion across Europe. With their 3000 employees they enable their customers to innovate safely, quickly and (cost) efficiently. With intelligent, thorough and independent research and reporting, they combine professional expertise with excellent IT-driven services. That’s how they set the standard.

Aanbod

Normec offers:
A competitive salary and bonus.
Being part of an international, ambitious team in a fast growing, successful organization.
Making a positive impact on our society: our services ensure a healthy and safe environment for many people.
Opportunity to expand and grow your career.
A lot of freedom in shaping your job the way you want.
Excellent lunches and Friday afternoon drinks in the Normec HQ in Utrecht.
Profiel

This is You:
10+ years of technical experience in the IT Infrastructure and Operations domain including 3+ years in a management role in a large multinational.
Master’s degree in Computer Science or Information Systems.
Experienced at leveraging resources that are located across multiple countries in Europe and offshore.
Up to date knowledge on Cloud, Data- and Information architecture and technology.
Good communication skills in Dutch and English (written and verbal); French or German is a plus.
Willingness to travel on a regular basis.
Result driven team player with a positive, energetic attitude.

job_titles: IT Audit Manager | Global FMCG Business | Amsterdam | The Netherlands
job_description:
Salary
Competitive Salary
Location
Amsterdam The Netherlands
Post Date
21 Mar 2023
Employment Type
Full Time
Job Number
22792
Line of Business
Audit & Risk
IT Audit, Technology & Cyber Security
Consultant
Gareth Mortimer

Our client is a leading international consumer goods Group, they are currently seeking an IT Audit Manager to be based in Amsterdam, The Netherlands. You will be part of a large audit, compliance and controls function, responsible for group-wide reviews and testing programmes, with a focus on working in a partnering capacity with the wider business.
IT Audit Manager Job Responsibilities:
The role of the IT Audit Manager is to work with senior management to enhance ‘business-processes’ and functionality within the department and the operating system (SAP/Hana).
You will take the lead on planning and delivering IT Audit activities across the function looking at the activities in SAP, ITGC, Security and Application Controls space.
You will be accountable for the ITGC reporting process system implementation planning and implementation protocol.
Particularly you will work on the integration of SAP Hana across all facets of the Internal Audit methodology.
You will develop high-quality audit reports and create test results using designated audit software.

Profile:
Ideally, you will have a Bachelor’s degree in Business, or Computer Science and professional certifications such as CISA, CIA, CPA or equivalent.
SAP, S/4 Hana, IT General Controls, Application Controls, SOX, ‘User Functionality’ activities and IT risk knowledge is needed.
Ideally, you will have strong experience within an accounting or audit consulting company and exposure to IT Audit and Security.
The candidate should have a genuine interest in the application of SAP Hana to improve business performance and controls.
Excellent command of written and spoken English. Other languages are a plus.
The role involves approximately 30% of travelling time.
Competent user of MS Office. Knowledge of SAP business processes and data analytics beneficial. Exposure to visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau, Alteryx) is a strong plus.

If you are interested, please send a copy of your up-to-date CV to Gareth Mortimer – gareth@renaix.com (Vacancy Ref: 22792).

The purpose of the Global Analytics Manager, is to support existing programs to advance business objectives and to identify opportunities, solve problems, and implement solutions. This role leads cross functional teams to define success indicators and performance drivers for global innovation programs. Also, collect and synthesize global datasets to further reporting, extract patterns to understand what drives outcomes and why, and translates results into a compelling narrative.

These are the main activities:
Leading operational analysis to identify gaps and opportunities across local and global data sets and to answer key business questions using SQL, Excel, and PowerBI.Collaborate with key region/country markets BI teams to develop intuitive reporting and provide visibility into key performance indicators across all Product & Application Security programs.Responsiblilty for developing KPIs to evaluate the success of the business’s initiatives.Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets from a wide variety of data sourcesOversee the data/report requests process: tracking requests submitted, prioritization, approval, etc.Work across multiple markets and functions to understand the business’s functional and data requirements. Communicate and train local business teams to drive adoption, consistency, and best practices

5+ years of related experience as a business intelligence analyst, data analyst, business analyst or similar roleProficiency in SQL and other programming/reporting tools (Python, R)Experience creating visualizations and dashboards using PowerBIBachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or related field, or equivalent professional experienceStrong business acumenStrong communication skills

Interested in this vacancy? Respond via the link below!

A competitive salary and benefits package.

Over de functie
Voor onze eindklant zoeken wij een BI-specialist met uitgebreide technische kennis van Cognos Analytics (v11), Javascript en Datawarehouse met uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden. Als BI-specialist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het zelfstandig uitvoeren van de opdracht om een set van 15 detaillijsten, 24 detailrapporten en 24 grafieken met bijbehorende documentatie op te leveren voor het Concern Dashboard 2.0.
In jouw rol gebruik je jouw kennis en vaardigheden om het ontwerp voor de datamart te maken en grafische rapporten en dashboards te creëren op basis van de aangeleverde brondata. Het is belangrijk dat je een T-shape profiel hebt en voldoende ervaring om het gewenste resultaat voor de klant binnen 12 maanden te bereiken. Je moet ook een brede interesse hebben in de vernieuwingen en moderne toepassingen van BI en een drive om bij te blijven in het vakgebied. Kennis van en ervaring met een Cognos suite (framework, reporting, dashboarding), Oracle Datawarehouse, stermodelering en het datavault principe zijn gewenst omdat de doorontwikkeling van BI een belangrijk onderdeel is van de functie.
Wat zijn jouw werkzaamheden?
Je bent in contact met de klant en maakt een goede vertaalslag in praktische oplossingen.
Je analyseert de aangeleverde brondata en maakt een ontwerp voor de datamart met geïntegreerde datamodellen. Vervolgens ontwikkel je grafische rapporten en dashboards op basis van de datamart.
Je gaat zelfstandig aan de slag met het ontwikkelen van 15 detaillijsten, 24 detailrapporten en 24 grafieken voor het Concern Dashboard 2.0.
Je biedt een brede BI ondersteuning op maat
Je gaat pro-actief meedenken en adviseren over BI-oplossingen
Je levert standaard informatieproducten: rapportages, dashboards en geografische producten.
Functie eisen
Eisen:
Je kan zelfstandig werken in een organisatie waarin je te maken krijgt met meerdere domeinen
Je bent communicatief vaardig en kan de Nederlandse taal goed beheersen.
Je hebt een scherpe analytisch en probleemoplossend vermogen
Je beschikt over een HBO-opleiding op het gebied van informatievoorziening (informatica, bedrijfskundige informatica, bedrijfskunde of computer science)
Je beschikt over minimaal 5 jaar ervaring met SQL, Cognos, CSS, Javascript en Motio CI/PI
Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar ervaring met Cognos Analytics (v11)
Je beschikt over kennis van de privacy wetgeving (AVG)

Over het bedrijf
null
Solliciteer
Herken jij jezelf in dit profiel? En lijkt werken bij Maandag® je een mooie stap? Solliciteer dan meteen. Wie weet ziet jouw maandag er binnenkort dan net zo tof uit als die van ons.

WO,HBO

3-6 jaar,6-10 jaar,Meer dan 10 jaar

So, you are a Data Engineer and want to build an international career for yourself here in the Netherlands? You want to learn more about the most complex Machine Learning concepts and develop your Python skills even further? You want to work for some of the Netherlands’ leading data-driven companies? And you’d like to be guided, supported, challenged, applauded and rewarded during the entire journey? Perfect, because that’s exactly what this company offers. And they’re looking for you.
Sounds like fun, but I’m not sure if I’m the right fit?
Of course, you are! After all, you’ve got a degree in a computer science related field, some impressive Python skills, and you’ve even had the chance to explore a bit of Docker and Apache Spark. Sure, some AWS or GCP experience could be nice. So who cares? Not me. The only other thing you’ll need is the right attitude.
Oh, don’t you worry. I’ve got plenty of attitude
Not sure if that’s the kind of attitude I had in mind, but fine. I guess by now, you’d like to know what’s in for you? Here you go:
Salary between €50.000 and €75.000 (based on how awesome you are)
Excellent secondary benefits - you know the drill: Amazing lunches, flexible working, room for personal development, and all the other good stuff
A highly-motivated team in a unique and fast-growing company
Still, reading? Just click apply and we’ll talk soon!

job_titles: Technisch Applicatiebeheerder / Nexidia Service Engineer - Den Haag en remote
job_description:
Functieomschrijving
Als Technisch Applicatiebeheerder / Nexidia Service Engineer ben je de centrale schakel tussen de functioneel beheerders en servicemanagers van opdrachtgevers en leveranciers. Je bent het aanspreekpunt voor wat betreft de continuïteit en de betrouwbaarheid van de Bumicom analytics cloud omgeving. Dankzij jou zijn onze analytics diensten altijd up to date en functioneren ze conform de afgesproken beschikbaarheid.

Jouw taken zijn:
Installeren van analytics applicaties zowel remote als op locatie
Uitvoeren van preventief en correctief onderhoud
Monitoren, bewaken en analyseren van de werking van applicaties en systemen
Analyseren en oplossen van incidenten
Reviewen en/of opstellen beheerdocumentatie t.b.v. applicatiebeheer en 2de lijn
Coördineren van wijzigingen
Het (mede) opstellen van risico- en impact-analyses.
Uitvoeren van / ondersteunen bij applicatie-installatie en -patching
Uitvoeren van applicatieconfiguratie
Verzorgen van telefonische en on-site technische ondersteuning van eindgebruikers en partners
Afstemming met toeleveranciers
Functie eisen
Werkervaring met Windows platform, SQL server, .Net framework applicaties, IIS en VMWare – 5 jaar
Werkervaring in een HBO functie (Informatica richting is een vereiste) - 5 jaar
Ervaring als applicatiebeheerder in middelgrote beheeromgevingen - 2 jaar
Kennis van en ervaring met IT in het algemeen en aanverwante security
Analytisch vermogen en affiniteit met complexe technische problemen
Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift
Verklaring Omtrent het Gedrag en klant specifieke screening is van toepassing

Daarnaast heb je:
Kennis en ervaring met Linux
Kennis en ervaring met cloud omgevingen
Kennis en ervaring met Telecom
Ervaring met het gebruik van een service management systeem
Bedrijfsprofiel
Onze klant levert Communicatie Recording en Quality Monitoring oplossingen voor Contact Centers, Financiële Instellingen, Openbare Orde & Veiligheid organisaties en Verkeersleiding. Daarbij combineert onze klant toewijding, vindingrijkheid, knowhow en marktkennis om te realiseren wat anderen alleen maar beloven.
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
Wij bieden jou:
Een bruto maandsalaris tussen de €3500 en €5000 op basis van 32 uur per week (bij voorkeur ben je fulltime beschikbaar);
Vakantiegeld;
Winstdeling;
Een auto van de zaak (mocht je dat willen);
De mogelijkheid om (na verloop van tijd) thuis te werken, ons kantoor zit in Den Haag.
Daarnaast word je blij van:
De hechte familiecultuur binnen de organisatie, iedere collega is namelijk down-to-earth en toegankelijk;
Een potje tafeltennis om af en toe te relaxen;
Hapjes en drankjes, die voor je geregeld worden!

En tot slot... Jouw leidinggevende wordt:
Gaynell Kromoidjojo, werkzaam als Projectmanager Telecommunicatie. Neem eens een kijkje op haar LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/gaynell-kromoidjojo-096b4b9/
Regio
Remote / Home
Publicatiedatum
24.02.2023
Contactpersoon
Gupta

Interesse in een BI-specialist traineeship? Lees dan de onderstaande vacature.

Functie

Als BI-specialist zorg jij niet alleen voor betrouwbare data-leveringen maar ook voor (visueel) krachtige rapportages aan al de (interne) klanten. Je analyseert de klantvraag én de achterliggende data. Jouw uitdaging is om goed te begrijpen met welke vraagstukken je klant worstelt, Je vertaalt deze naar oplossingen door middel van (dimensionele) modellen, implementatie van de hieruit voortvloeiende ETL en ontwikkeling van rapportages en dashboards.
Samen met je directe collega’s geef jij vorm aan het ontwikkelen en leveren van moderne data-producten en -diensten. Deze producten en diensten stellen onze klanten beter in staat om hun operationele en financiële beleid te monitoren en hun risico’s in te schatten en te beheersen. Je vindt het leuk om hierover met klanten in gesprek te gaan en met hen te sparren.
Door je collega BI-consultants constant feedback te geven, maak je ook hen ‘elke dag een beetje beter’. Je neemt deel aan teambijeenkomsten en deelt daar je kennis en inzichten waar nodig. Je controleert je eigen werk en dat van anderen, onderzoekt en analyseert vraagstukken, vaak in samenwerking met onze interne klanten, en je zorgt voor passende oplossingen waar zij zich in herkennen. Bovenal begrijp je dat het je eigen maken van kennis over de strategische processen binnen TenneT TSO B.V. en de data binnen deze processen, jouw basis is om succesvol te worden.
Samen met onze opleidingspartner IT Academie Noord (samenwerkingsinitiatief met o.a. Hanze Hogeschool Groningen en Hogeschool Arnhem Nijmegen) zullen wij de trainees van een Technisch inhoudelijk opleidingstraject voorzien.
Het interne technische opleidingsprogramma ziet er als volgt uit:
SQL, beheersen/snappen.
Agile werken, Scrum methodiek.
Dimensioneel modelleren.
Het bouwen van ETL-processen.
Het bouwen van Rapportages en Dashboards.
Bedrijf

TenneT is een toonaangevende Europese netbeheerder (Transmission System Operator, TSO) met zijn belangrijkste activiteiten in Nederland en Duitsland. Met ruim 23.000 kolometer aan hoogspanningsverbindingen zorgen zij voor een betrouwbare en zekere elektriciteitsvoorziening aan 41 miljoen eindgebruikers in de markten die zij bedienen.

Aanbod

Er zijn allerlei mogelijkheden om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen, maar we hebben ook oog voor je balans werk/privé. Verder kun je bij rekenen op een goed salaris, een nette pensioenregeling en eigentijdse, flexibele arbeidsvoorwaarden geregeld.

Profiel
Trainees hebben een afgeronde (bij voorkeur) wo Bachelor of Master opleiding in de richting van Computer Science, informatica, Business & IT of aanverwant.
Trainees hebben vanuit eigen opleiding een sterke achtergrond in programmeren en hebben hier gedurende de studie ook veel aantoonbare praktische programmeer ervaring mee opgedaan.
Trainees hebben gewerkt vanuit de stage met data-analyse, ETL en dimensionele modellen.

Why would you have so many solar panels when you could generate more energy from less surface area? Or if your roof is small, you need every square inch to be as profitable as possible. So let’s fix that.
What is this about?
Not many people know that their solar panels could be much more productive. And the energy transition is for a big part dependent on the power of the sun, so we need to use that as efficiently as possible. We lose power and we don’t know about it either. It’s time we find every Watt we can.
You can do that by working at this company, which has found a way to track the performance of a solar panel. Local shading and aging of the cell can cause losses in productivity. Their system is designed to be sure every single cell generates as much energy as possible. From the insights they gather, they create advice on what their clients can trust to be much more productive.
How can I contribute?
As an embedded software developer, your main responsibility will be further developing and maintaining this company’s embedded software. This consists of two products: the solar optimizer and the gateway. Both include real-time microcontrollers (8051 core SiLabs EFM8) for real-time and critical functions and the gateway has a microcontroller (ESP32) running FreeRTOS for all other functionality. You will be working on both applications and will create embedded software for the devices themselves, testers and any additional tooling.
Do I have the required skills to work here?
Don’t worry. With a bachelor's or master's degree in electronics, Computer Science, or an embedded software-related major you will come a long way. It is furthermore important that you have working experience in embedded software development (3+ years). Experience with software architecture design and with low-level embedded C comes in handy as well.
And what do I get in return?
Your work is highly appreciated by this company. Therefore, it is only right that you will get a nice salary in return, which will be between €60.000 and €80.000. You can also count on excellent fringe benefits. So what are you waiting for? Apply now!

Bedrijfsomschrijving
Your new employer is a true leader in innovation, design and manufacture of high-powered chargers for electric vehicles. Do you want to know everything about this company and this position? Then there is only one thing left to do: apply!

Working hours
In this full-time role you work 40 hours a week, from Monday until Friday. The working hours are between 8.30 am and 17.00 pm.
Functieomschrijving
As a born engineer, you’ve never been stumped by any sort of electrical problem. That's exactly why this company is very eager to offer you a direct contract right away. And that’s not all! Your rewards also include a gross salary of €3.500 per month plus a reimbursement of your travel expenses. Want to know how to ensure this job is yours soon? Then read on and apply!

Manpower is looking for a commissioning field engineer for a company in Amsterdam.

As a commissioning field engineer, you will be responsible for all pre- and post-sale technical field support. Simply put, you’re the one that finds all kinds of solutions for the customers of this client. You provide this service at different locations of the customer, spread all over Europe. So it is important that you are willing to travel to these different sites (approximately 80% of the time). Your key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Executing all field service activities according to company policies and procedures
Liaising with all clients and suppliers
Working with, guiding and monitoring subcontractors on site and remotely
Generating and submitting reports and other technical documentation outputs
Performing integration, validation and verification testing

What's in it for you
A direct contract with the company!
Gross salary of €3.500 per month
Reimbursement of travel costs
Full-time job of 40 hours a week
Loads of opportunities to develop yourself and grow

Functie-eisen

At least a EQF level 6 or higher (Bachelor's degree or Master's degree or PhD) in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or similar
Understanding of OCPP protocol, Linux, programming, integration and debugging
At least three years of experience working with LV mains to 480VAC and DC systems up to 1000V
Good command of the English language, so that you can fully understand the work and safety instructions
Availability of 40 hours per week and flexibility for travelling within Europe as required to provide on-site installation coordination

It is not mandatory, but do you already have experience working with PCBs/ESD sensitive equipment? Then this will benefit you greatly!

Don’t let another day go by where you didn’t apply for this amazing job! Afterwards, Manpower will contact you within two working days

Functieomschrijving

Introduction to the job
IT P&T is a sub-department within the IT organization. This department is responsible for the infrastructure and tooling for ASML’s software development and engineering department. The sub-department is organized in two Agile Release Trains (ARTs): the Software Platform ART and the Software Innovation ART. The two trains are responsible for the complete software development environment for the ASML Scanner software and are a critical platform for the software development department in ASML.
The expert will be active in the Vcubes team, part of the SW Platform ART, which focuses on maintaining and supporting the backend systems for the Clearcase and ClearQuest applications, which are used by about 2500 developers on a daily basis.
We are looking for a senior IT Technical Specialist with strong expertise in ClearCase and ClearQuest. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background, a passion for problem-solving, and a desire to provide great customer service on those products to support the ASML Scanner SCM system.
Maintain and modify the implementation of the ASML Scanner SCM system, which is mainly based on ClearCase UCM and ClearQuest, and do this in cooperation with the members of the team, the departmental architects, and our stakeholders.
Role and responsibilities
Take ownership of our Scanner SCM system and gain detailed knowledge about it
Provide technical support to our customers (software developers)
Perform impact analysis on changes in the Scanner SCM system
Monitor the environment and the performance of the system
Be a partner in discussions with architects and internal stakeholders
Collaborate with colleagues to ensure system integration and functionality
Education and experience
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
3+ years of experience in a technical support role in a large complex development environment
Strong knowledge of the IBM/HCL products ClearCase and ClearQuest
Strong knowledge of scripting languages, mainly Perl, Bash, and Python
Hands-on knowledge of Linux/Unix environments.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Skills
Excellent communication skills and fluent English-speaking
Able to show initiative and have a good problem-solving attitude
Pragmatic, practical, flexible, and committed to quality
Ambitious and with a pro-active, initiating attitude
Have the ability to plan and set priorities
Team worker and customer-oriented
Service-minded and able to work against deadlines
Able to think practically about the impact of certain decisions
Arbeidsvoorwaarden

Regular Dayshift (3 days working in the office in Veldhoven).
Gross monthly salary between €4500 and €5300.

Higher education, bachelor degree

3 - 5 years

Do you want to help us deliver the next ground-breaking innovative AI solutions that will transform the video and media industry?

We develop state-of-the-art technologies that revolutionise how people watch (online) television. We provide unique AI technology to understand what’s inside video.

Our Deep Content Understanding™ solution generates next-gen metadata, enabling consumers and media professionals globally to search and analyze video content in real time and at an unparalleled scale. Working at Media Distillery as a Java Backend Engineer means you have the mentality to fix what is broken and continuously improve. Both systems and yourself.
Curious about our company Tech Stack?
Have a look here


What you’ll do
As a Java Backend Engineer, you have a clear vision of the latest technologies and preach the best practices of your field. Imagine being part of a real product, actively applying machine learning in a real production environment, and pitching your ideas to key decision-makers. You will share your ideas and inspire others in the team by sharing your knowledge and offering your guidance. But most importantly you will design, develop, test, monitor and expand one of our products. You build it, you run it.
In sum you will:

Automate the development cycle and creation of our platform using Kubernetes, Helm, Jenkins, and other tools
Design, develop, test, and monitor our state-of-the-art AI technologies
Facilitate the implementation and adoption of new tools and technologies like Cassandra, Elasticsearch, and more
Closely cooperate with the team in understanding and implementing new features to the platform

What we offer
Besides being able to develop the next generation of media experiences together with a fantastic group of international colleagues in an entrepreneurial startup environment we offer:
The opportunity to learn and develop yourself in a fast-moving company with lots of room for own initiatives
An annual training budget to work on your skills or to use for events
Fun company events and an annual multi-day company trip
Bi-weekly outdoor workout with our personal trainer
Everything you need for your home office
Travel expenses reimbursed
The opportunity to work at an award-winning innovative company
Flexible working hours with the possibility to work from home when needed
Great coffee and free (healthy) snacks
Standing desks
Reimbursement of your streaming subscriptions up to 300 euro per year
Compensations for your phone and internet use, as well as a “Working from home compensation”
An amazing office in the centre of Amsterdam
Unlimited vacation days
Salary range between 4000 and 5000 euros/month (gross) depending on skills and experience.
Ready to meet us?

If you are excited about this role, then we can’t wait to meet you. Send us your CV and a cover letter and we will come back to you asap!
In a nutshell, this is you:

You are fluent in English and you have a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science (or similar)
You thrive in a startup/scaleup environment where new ideas are embraced
You have experience with DevOps practices and tooling
You are passionate about Java but are an all-round developer
You have excellent problem solving, critical thinking and interpersonal skills
You have experience with data-driven decisions
Bonus Points if...

You understand Linux server environments, Docker and Kubernetes
You are brilliant at using modern frameworks, such as Springboot
You understand and have implemented different levels of testing (Unit, System, integration)
You have a master’s degree in Computer Science (or similar)
You have worked with NoSQL technologies (Cassandra, Elasticsearch)
You have experience in CI/CD, system admin and cloud computing

Wat je gaat doen:

Gaan er lampjes op oranje? Jij schiet in de actie en voorkomt rood. Als systeembeheerder ben je de troubleshooter die complexe vraagstukken oplost. Stabiliteit is je doel: jij zorgt dat de systemen blijven draaien. Je ontwerpt en implementeert Microsoftomgevingen, verzorgt updates en doet preventief onderhoud. Daarbij heb je een scherp oog voor risico’s. Ter plekke bedenk je oplossingen en begeleid je de klant bij het maken van inrichtingskeuzes. Nu we het over onze klanten hebben: je werkt voor grote namen. Denk aan ministeries, de politie, gemeentes, de Belastingdienst, KLM, VodafoneZiggo en ING. Je netwerk blijft groeien en daarmee ook je ervaring. Bij DPA mogen je ambities groot zijn; die belonen we. Doorgroeien tot Cloud beheerder bijvoorbeeld? Jij bent aan zet!
Verder werk jij aan jouw eigen toekomst, binnen uitdagende en afwisselende projecten. Je spart vaak met jouw DPA-IT collega’s binnen een positieve werkomgeving.
En: jij hebt de lead bij de opdrachten waaraan je werkt. Zo pak je als Infrastructuur beheerder bij DPA de regie over je carrière.


Wat we vragen:

Een goed onderlegde professional die nauw kan samenwerken met opdrachtgevers. Jij krijgt energie van migratievraagstukken en kunt helder uitleggen welke oplossing leidt tot het gewenste resultaat. Van nature ben je ondernemend en heb je een pragmatische werkhouding. En omdat er bij DPA ook ruimte is voor plezier, is jouw goede gevoel voor humor meer dan welkom.
Verder heb je:HBO-niveau en relevante werkervaring. Een diploma in de richting van informatica is mooi meegenomen;Microsoftcertificeringen, bijvoorbeeld AZ-303/AZ-304, en aantoonbare ervaring daarmee;Ervaring met PowerShell en Ansible/Automation;Een goede kennis van Microsoft Windows, Windows Server, SCOM, Intune en Azure AD;Basiskennis van scripting en netwerken, bijvoorbeeld CCNA;Bij voorkeur kennis van Vmware en Citrix.


Wat we bieden:

Werk je bij DPA, dan doe je ertoe. Jij staat centraal. Daarom investeren we in jouw ontwikkeling via opleidingen en trainingen. Met je talentmanager heb je regelmatig face-to-facecontact, en we organiseren uitjes met de hele community. Naast deze gezelligheid is er natuurlijk ook werk aan de winkel. Samen stippelen we een carrièrepad uit waarmee jij jezelf continu uitdaagt. We willen graag dat jij van ons leert, en wij willen leren van jou. En daar horen natuurlijk goede arbeidsvoorwaarden bij.
Waar je op kunt rekenen:
- Een goed salaris tussen € 4.000,- en € 5.500,- bruto per maand op basis van 40 uur per week, afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring. Liever parttime aan de slag? Ook dat is mogelijk.Een contract voor onbepaalde tijd;Een leaseauto met tankpas EN een NS-Business Card.25 vakantiedagen.Een goede pensioenregeling.Bonusregelingen bóvenop je salaris.Korting op je zorgverzekering.De mogelijkheid om certificaten te behalen: samen zorgen we ervoor dat jij doorgroeit.


Je werkomgeving:

Je gaat aan de slag voor DPA IT, onderdeel van de DPA Group. In een vakgebied dat zich razendsnel ontwikkelt, faciliteren wij professionals die willen blijven groeien. We geven je passende opdrachten én houden je certificeringen up-to-date. Omdat we flink groeien, zoeken we IT-specialisten die er plezier in hebben om samen met collega’s innovatief bezig te zijn. We zijn benieuwd naar jouw technische knowhow en laten ons daar graag in meenemen.
Je bent eruit: het is tijd om de regie te pakken over je carrière. Na je sollicitatie nemen we contact met je op en bespreken we de mogelijkheden. Daarna volgen twee gesprekken om elkaar beter te leren kennen en dieper in te gaan op jouw ambities. Op ons kantoor, op een locatie bij jou in de buurt of via een videocall. Soms vragen we je een assessment te maken of spreken we af bij de opdrachtgever. Besluiten we samen het avontuur aan te gaan? Dan maken we je contract in orde en kun je aan de slag.
